qas.question: what is the code point of the BOM?
What is U+UFFE the result of?
What is the code point for BOM?
What changes the important property in BOM?
What are UCS-2 and UTF-16 specified by?
What is the abbreviation for UCS-2 and UTF-16?

context: The <a1_0>UCS-2 and UTF-16<a1_0/> encodings specify <b7_0>the <a0_0>Unicode Byte Order Mark<b7_0/><a0_0/> (<b8_0>BOM<b8_0/>) for use at the beginnings of text files, which may be used for byte ordering detection (or byte endianness detection). The BOM, code point <a2_0><b4_0>U+FEFF<b4_0/><a2_0/> has the important property of unambiguity on byte reorder, regardless of <b5_0>the Unicode encoding used<b5_0/>; U+FFFE (the result of <a3_0>byte-swapping U+FEFF<a3_0/>) does not equate to <b6_0>a legal character<b6_0/>, and U+FEFF in other places, other than the beginning of text, conveys the zero-width non-break space (a character with no appearance and no effect other than preventing the formation of ligatures).
